definition: vast, with no clear boundary/fig. hazy/indistinct/unclear/confused

sentences.english: Pablo looked at him through his bleary eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去目光呆滞，茫然若失。

sentences.english: I puzzled over it for hours before it finally clicked .
sentences.chinese: 我对这一问题茫然不解，几小时后终于顿开茅塞。

sentences.english: Still he stared at me. Now his eyes were blank and looking through me.
sentences.chinese: 他仍然盯着我，他的眼光有些茫然，似乎不在看我。

sentences.english: Romeo stared blankly at the dead body at his feet.
sentences.chinese: 罗密欧茫然地瞪视著他脚边的尸体。

sentences.english: Thank you for never being sarcastic The thing that baffles and bewilders a child.
sentences.chinese: 感谢您从不冷嘲热讽孩子眼中感到迷惑茫然的事情。

sentences.english: As if unsure of where he is, she hesitated and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 她仿佛茫然不知声身在何处，犹豫地向四周打量。

sentences.english: The students didn’t even stare blankly at me.
sentences.chinese: 学生们甚至不肯茫然抬头看我一眼。

sentences.english: As if unsure of where she was, she hesitated and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 她仿佛茫然不知身在何处，犹犹豫豫向四周看。

sentences.english: One evening she was staring vacantly at an embroidered hanging.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，她茫然地凝视着一张挂毯。

sentences.english: Having no idea at the time what may lie ahead.
sentences.chinese: 那时，前路对我来说还茫然一片。

sentences.english: She always has a gormless look in meetings.
sentences.chinese: 开会她总是一副一脸茫然的表情。

sentences.english: In vacant or in pensive mood.
His strange behaviour perplexed her greatly.
sentences.chinese: 他的奇怪举止使她茫然不解。
她现在看起来茫然而笨拙。

sentences.english: You are still fumbling in tatal hopelessness?
sentences.chinese: 你还在失望中茫然无措吗？

sentences.english: I was at a loss when I first entered the classroom with these students.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次走进这些学生所在的教室的时候，深感茫然。

definition: not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
anxious and perplexed/uneasy and confused/suspicious and fearful
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
